page.title: 07FARMING(HOLT/STAVERTON AREA)
page.content: We did a survey on all the farms in our area. Most of the land in the area which is not used for housing or shops is used for farming, most of which is dairy farming. All the dairy farms have at least a hundred acres each. They use their land for grass and to make hay and silage. Most of the herds consist of Friesian cows for milking, but the farmers also keep beef cows and two of them have bulls. All the dairy cattle are milked at least twice a day using modern machinery. All the animals on the dairy farms are kept inside from November to April. There is a large cattle market in nearby Chippenham where most of the buying and selling of the cattle in the area takes place. There is one pig farm that has over two thousand pigs. The pigs are kept for 18 months and then sold for bacon.
